By default, Samba uses theÂ tdbsamÂ back end and stores the database in theÂ /usr/local/samba/private/passdb.tdbÂ file. Optionally set a different location in theÂ smb.confÂ file using theÂ passdb backendÂ parameter. import socket


def main():

    tcp_socket.connect((dest_ip, dest_port))

    want_file = input("è¯·è¾“å…¥ä½ è¦ä¸‹è½½çš„æ–‡ä»¶ï¼š")

import socket


def send_file2client(new_socket, client_addr):

def main():

        send_file2client(new_socket, client_addr)

private static class User {

}

// å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªå¸¦è¿”å›å€¼çš„ä»»åŠ¡ï¼Œå®ç°Callableæ¥å£
class TaskWithResult implements Callable<String>{

    }
ã€€ã€€ // è¿™ä¸ªå°±æ˜¯æä¾›è¿”å›å€¼çš„æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œå½“è·å–è¿”å›å€¼æ—¶å®é™…ä¼šè°ƒç”¨è¿™ä¸ªæ–¹æ³•

public class CallableDemo{
    public static void main(String[] args){
        ExecutorService exec = Executors.newCachedThreadPool();
        ArrayList<Futrue<String>> results = new ArrayList<Future<String>>();
        for(int i = 0; i<10 ; i++){
ã€€ã€€ã€€ã€€ã€€ã€€  // æäº¤ä»»åŠ¡ä¹‹åä¼šè¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªFutureï¼Œå¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡å®ƒçš„getæ–¹æ³•è·å–ä»»åŠ¡è®¡ç®—è¿”å›çš„ç»“æœ
            results.add(exec.submit(new TaskWithResult(i)));
        }
        for(Future<String> fs : results){
            try{
                // è°ƒç”¨get()æ–¹æ³•æ—¶å¿…è¦çš„è¯(è®¡ç®—ä»»åŠ¡æœªå®Œæˆ)ä¼šé˜»å¡
                System.out.println(fs.get());
            }catch(InterruptedException e){
                System.out.println(e);
                return;
            }catch(ExecutionExecution e){
                System.out.println(e);
                return;
            }finally{
                exec.shutdown();
            }
        }
    }
}

 public ThreadPoolExecutor(int corePoolSize,
                              int maximumPoolSize,
                              long keepAliveTime,
                              TimeUnit unit,
                              BlockingQueue<Runnable> workQueue,
                              ThreadFactory threadFactory,
                              RejectedExecutionHandler handler) {
    if (corePoolSize < 0 ||
        maximumPoolSize <= 0 ||
        maximumPoolSize < corePoolSize ||
        keepAliveTime < 0)
        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
    if (workQueue == null || threadFactory == null || handler == null)
        throw new NullPointerException();
    this.corePoolSize = corePoolSize;
    this.maximumPoolSize = maximumPoolSize;
    this.workQueue = workQueue;
    this.keepAliveTime = unit.toNanos(keepAliveTime);
    this.threadFactory = threadFactory;
    this.handler = handler;
}

private final AtomicInteger ctl = new AtomicInteger(ctlOf(RUNNING, 0));

// å·¥ä½œçº¿ç¨‹çš„ç†è®ºä¸Šé™ï¼Œå¤§çº¦5äº¿å¤šä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹

ä»£ç ä¸­å±äºé“¾å¼è°ƒç”¨ï¼Œç”±äºå¤ªé•¿æ²¡æœ‰æ¢è¡Œï¼Œç«Ÿç„¶æ²¡çœ‹åˆ°åè¾¹çš„setDetectNoop,setDocAsUpsertå‚æ•°çš„è°ƒç”¨ï¼Œäºæ˜¯æ€è€ƒï¼ŒjavaClientä¸å°±æ˜¯å°è£…å’Œè½¬æ¢äº†è°ƒç”¨è¯·æ±‚ä¹ˆï¼Œäºæ˜¯å†å›åˆ°å®˜ç½‘æŸ¥çœ‹Document APIsï¼Œæ‰¾åˆ°updateæ“ä½œçš„è¯´æ˜ï¼Œå°±æœ‰äº†ä¸‹è¾¹å…³äº Detecting Noop Updates ä»¥åŠ Upsertsè¯´æ˜ï¼š

Detecting noop updatesedit

IfÂ docÂ is specified its value is merged with the existingÂ _source. By default the document is only reindexed if the newÂ _sourceÂ field differs from the old. SettingÂ detect_noopÂ toÂ falseÂ will cause Elasticsearch to always update the document even if it hasnâ€™t changed. For example:

curl -XPOST 'localhost:9200/test/type1/1/_update' -d '{
    "doc" : {
        "name" : "new_name"
    },
    "detect_noop": false
}'

ä¸Šè¾¹è¿™æ®µçš„æ„æ€æ˜¯å½“æ›´æ–°çš„æ–‡æ¡£å‘ç”Ÿå˜åŒ–æ—¶è¿›è¡Œæ›´æ–°ï¼Œå¦‚æœä¸ºfasle,åˆ™å§‹ç»ˆæ›´æ–°ã€‚

Upsertsedit

If the document does not already exist, the contents of theÂ upsertÂ element will be inserted as a new document. If the document does exist, then theÂ scriptÂ will be executed instead:

curl -XPOST 'localhost:9200/test/type1/1/_update' -d '{
    "script" : {
        "inline": "ctx._source.counter += count",
        "params" : {
            "count" : 4
        }
    },
    "upsert" : {
        "counter" : 1
    }
}'

scripted_upsertedit

If you would like your script to run regardless of whether the document exists or notâ€‰â€”â€‰i.e. the script handles initializing the document instead of theÂ upsertÂ elementâ€‰â€”â€‰then setÂ scripted_upsertÂ toÂ true:

curl -XPOST 'localhost:9200/sessions/session/dh3sgudg8gsrgl/_update' -d '{
    "scripted_upsert":true,
    "script" : {
        "id": "my_web_session_summariser",
        "params" : {
            "pageViewEvent" : {
                "url":"foo.com/bar",
                "response":404,
                "time":"2014-01-01 12:32"
            }
        }
    },
    "upsert" : {}
}'

doc_as_upsertedit

Instead of sending a partialÂ docÂ plus anÂ upsertÂ doc, settingÂ doc_as_upsertÂ toÂ trueÂ will use the contents ofÂ docÂ as theÂ upsertÂ value:

curl -XPOST 'localhost:9200/test/type1/1/_update' -d '{
    "doc" : {
        "name" : "new_name"
    },
    "doc_as_upsert" : true
}'

using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc;
using SmartSqlSampleChapterOne.DataAccess;
using SmartSqlSampleChapterOne.Entity;
using System.Collections.Generic;

namespace SmartSqlSampleChapterOne.Controllers
{
    /// <summary>
    /// 
    /// </summary>
    [Route("[controller]/[action]")]
    public class ArticleController : Controller
    {
        private readonly ArticleDataAccess _articleDataAccess;

        /// <summary>
        /// constructor
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="articleDataAccess"></param>
        public ArticleController(ArticleDataAccess articleDataAccess)
        {
            _articleDataAccess = articleDataAccess;
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// 
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="article"></param>
        /// <returns></returns>
        [HttpPost]
        public T_Article Add([FromBody] T_Article article)
        {
            article.Id = _articleDataAccess.Insert(article);
            return article;
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// 
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="id"></param>
        /// <returns></returns>
        [HttpGet]
        public T_Article Get([FromQuery] long id)
        {
            return _articleDataAccess.GetById(id);
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// 
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="article"></param>
        /// <returns></returns>
        [HttpPost]
        public bool Update([FromBody] T_Article article)
        {
            return _articleDataAccess.Update(article) > 0;
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// 
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="id"></param>
        /// <param name="status"></param>
        /// <returns></returns>
        [HttpPost]
        public bool UpdateStatus([FromQuery] long id, [FromQuery] int status)
        {
            return _articleDataAccess.DyUpdate(new
            {
                Id = id,
                Status = status
            }) > 0;
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// 
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="id"></param>
        /// <returns></returns>
        [HttpGet]
        public bool IsExist([FromQuery] long id)
        {
            return _articleDataAccess.IsExist(new
            {
                Id = id
            });
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// 
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="key"></param>
        /// <returns></returns>
        [HttpGet]
        public IEnumerable<T_Article> Query([FromQuery] string key = "")
        {
            return _articleDataAccess.Query(new
            {
                Title = key
            });
        }
    }
}
